article.title: The 3.5 keV Line from Stringy Axions

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 1 depicts a model for the 3.5 keV line from galaxy clusters. What is the role of the closed string axion \'cp\' in this model?
choices: It is the ultra-light ALP which converts into photons.
It is the decaying dark matter particle with a mass of ~7 keV.
It controls the volume of the large divisor \'Db\'.

multiple_choice_question.text: The formula Λ · M ∼ 7 · 10^28 GeV^2 represents a key constraint in the model explaining the 3.5 keV line. What do the parameters Λ and M represent?
choices: Λ is the ALP decay constant and M is the DM-ALP coupling scale.
Λ is the DM-ALP coupling scale and M is the ALP-photon coupling scale.
Λ is the ALP-photon coupling scale and M is the DM mass.
Λ is the DM mass and M is the ALP mass.

multiple_choice_question.text: The formula V = τ_b^(3/2) − τ_s^(3/2) − (τ_s + τ_p)^(3/2) − τ_q1^(3/2) − τ_q2^(3/2) describes the volume of the Calabi-Yau manifold. What is the significance of the term (τ_s + τ_p)^(3/2)?
choices: It represents the volume of the large divisor \'Db\'.
It accounts for the presence of the \'Wilson divisor\' \'Dp\'.
It represents the volume of the rigid del Pezzo four-cycle \'Ds\'.
It accounts for the presence of non-intersecting blow-up modes \'Dq1\' and \'Dq2\'.

multiple_choice_question.text: The formula V_poly^F (cp) = A/V^(3+p) cos(2πcp) describes the scalar potential contribution for the DM axion \'cp\' from poly-instanton effects. What does the parameter \'p\' signify in this formula?
choices: It determines the mass of the DM axion \'cp\'.
It determines the strength of the DM-ALP coupling.
It controls the volume dependence of the potential contribution.
It represents the number of poly-instanton cycles.
